Talking Points
1.The Pure Dark 70% Cocoabar is from Madagascar.
•These have notes of red fruit, like cherry and 
raspberry.
2.The Salted Caramel 73% Cocoaand Toasted 
Hazelnut 73%bars are from Uganda.
•These are rich and chocolatey with notes of 
vanilla and apricot.
3.These bars have those unique flavors because they 
are single origin chocolate. These are the only single 
origin chocolate in Whole Foods Market that was 
made in Africa.
4.Beyond Good purchases its cocoa directly from 
farmers in Madagascar and Uganda.
5.Our company annually tests for heavy metal in our 
chocolate.

Equipment & Supplies NeededEvent Kit Contents (Shipped to Store)
•Gloves  –REQUIRED
•Sneeze Guard –REQUIRED for Open & Serve Demos
•Face Mask –SEE STORE POLICY
•Metal Tray
•Cutting Board + Knife (optional)
•Sample Cups
•No event kit for this demo
Goal: Sell 15 units of product if stock is available
PRODUCT ALLOWANCE: $36

1.Clean and sanitize demo cart before using.
2.Write product name and price on chalkboard neatly.
3.One chocolate bar yields 30 samples.
4.When customer requests a sample, break off or cut one square from the chocolate bar and put it into a 
sample cup.
5.Place sample on the metal tray for customer to take. Do not hand sample directly to customer. Do not 
prepare samples ahead of time!
6.Share the product information and talking points while passing out samples.
7.Take note of customer comments about the product (likes, dislikes, etc.) to submit in your recap.
8.Save each empty package to purchase at the end of your shift.
1.Clean and sanitize all demo equipment & supplies, let dry then return to demo cabinet.
2.Refer to Event Procedures for detailed cleaning instructions & FAQ’s.
3.Clean and sanitize the demo cart and return to demo zone.
•Do not leave anything in the demo cart
4.At the end of your shift, you will purchase the featured products with a maximum spending limitof $36.
•Make sure to select DEBITwhen making purchases
•Do not exceed the maximum spending limit
5.Make sure to save all receipts and submit them with your Event Receipt Form at the end of your shift.
6.If you’ve reached your maximum spending limit, spend the remaining time on your shift performing an 
educational demo.
